page.title: 06A Shop in Sharlston.
page.content: My Grandad has a butcher's shop on Weeland Road in Sharlston. He sells all sorts of meat which he gets from the abbattoir in Leeds. As well as cuts of meat he sells pork pies, sausage rolls, buns and pastries which he makes himself. Alf and Steven, who work for Grandad, bake all these things in the bakery behind the shop. Grandad, Grandma, Norman, Roger and sometimes Steven as well, all work in the shop serving people. The shop is open Tuesday - Friday, 9.00 - 5.30 and Saturday 9.00 - 12.30. Saturday is always the busiest day and Christmas is always the busiest time when he sells lots of turkeys. At the moment Grandad is on holiday and Roger is the boss. Most of the customers live in Sharlston and are old people.
